description:
take possession of, especially by force, have as a possession, often with
        collateral idea of taking in place of others, succeeding to, inheriting
         (compare 2)

senses.description:
take possession of, especially by force, have as a possession, often with
        collateral idea of taking in place of others, succeeding to, inheriting
         (compare 2)
followed by accusative of person = be one's heir

cause (others) to possess or inherit
        ,
        then generally dispossess
